record.title: ORDERS FOR SUNDAY, JULY 27 AND MONDAY, JULY 28, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR SUNDAY, JULY 27 AND MONDAY, JULY 28, 2008 -- (Senate - July 26, 2008)

[Page: S7537]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it adjourn until 10 a.m. tomorrow morning, Sunday, July 27, for a pro forma session only; that following the pro forma session, the Senate adjourn until 3 p.m., Monday, July 28; that following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and the Senate resume consideration of the motion to proceed to S. 3297, a bill to advance America's priorities, and that the time until 4 p.m. be equally divided between the two leaders or their designees.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I suggest the absence of a quorum.

record.chair: The clerk will call the roll.
The assistant legislative clerk proceeded to call the roll.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the order for the quorum call be rescinded.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
